title: WCAS LATIN 201-3-20 Introduction to Latin Literature

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
The third quarter of second-year Latin combines literary analysis with mastery of grammar and syntax at the intermediate level. A grade of C- or better satisfies the WCAS language requirement.
This is mainly a workshop course, with discussion focusing on questions by members of the course. Though translation will be a component in evaluation, it will be a relatively minor criterion of success. The main topics of discussion will be how meaning and emphasis are communicated in Latin.
Though Latin 201-3 concentrates on language skills, it also develops skills of analysis that are foundational for the future study of literature in any language.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: PREREQUISITES: Successful completion of Latin 201-2 or by placement test. Students who earned a 4 on the AP Latin exam can enroll in the class without taking the placement test. For further information, contact the Director of Latin Instruction Francesca Tataranni (f-tataranni@northwestern.edu).

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Discussion, with emphasis on student participation. Ownership of this class is entirely in the students' hands, with the instructor functioning as facilitator.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance and participation in class, weekly quizzes, a translation project with a final examination for students with less than an A average.
